required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Paracervical Block Versus No Paracervical Block During IUD Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Paracervical Block Versus No Paracervical Block During IUD Insertion

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the pain level and level of discomfort with paracervical block versus no analgesia in women who present to the University of Texas (UT) Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology Continuity Clinic, The UT Physicians Women's Center, and the UT Physicians Women's Center- Bellaire for IUD insertion.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Score as Assessed by a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (about 30 seconds after insertion of the speculum)
primary_outcome.description: The order of overall events are: insertion of speculum, assessment of pain via a visual analogue scale (VAS) (about 30 seconds after insertion of the speculum), injection of 2cc 1% lidocaine at the tenaculum site of the cervix, placement of tenaculum (about 2-3 minutes after insertion of speculum), assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the tenaculum), injection of 3cc 1% lidocaine at the 4 and 8 o'clock position of the cervix, insert IUD (about 4-5 minutes after insertion of tenaculum), and assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the IUD). The Faces pain VAS was used, which ranges from 0 (very happy, no hurt) to 10 (hurts as much as you can imagine).

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Score as Assessed by a Visual Analogue Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: about 30 seconds after insertion of the tenaculum (tenaculum inserted about 2 to 3 minutes after insertion of speculum)
primary_outcome.description: The order of overall events are: insertion of speculum, assessment of pain via a visual analogue scale (VAS) (about 30 seconds after insertion of the speculum), injection of 2cc 1% lidocaine at the tenaculum site of the cervix, placement of tenaculum (about 2-3 minutes after insertion of speculum), assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the tenaculum), injection of 3cc 1% lidocaine at the 4 and 8 o'clock position of the cervix, insert IUD (about 4-5 minutes after insertion of tenaculum), and assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the IUD). The Faces pain VAS was used, which ranges from 0 (very happy, no hurt) to 10 (hurts as much as you can imagine).

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Score as Assessed by a Visual Analogue Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: about 30 seconds after insertion of the IUD (IUD inserted about 4 to 5 minutes after insertion of tenaculum)
primary_outcome.description: The order of overall events are: insertion of speculum, assessment of pain via a visual analogue scale (VAS) (about 30 seconds after insertion of the speculum), injection of 2cc 1% lidocaine at the tenaculum site of the cervix, placement of tenaculum (about 2-3 minutes after insertion of speculum), assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the tenaculum), injection of 3cc 1% lidocaine at the 4 and 8 o'clock position of the cervix, insert IUD (about 4-5 minutes after insertion of tenaculum), and assessment of pain via VAS (about 30 seconds after insertion of the IUD). The Faces pain VAS was used, which ranges from 0 (very happy, no hurt) to 10 (hurts as much as you can imagine).

arm_group.description: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.

intervention.description: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.
IUD placement with or without paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women of reproductive age who present for an IUD insertion procedure at the University of Texas Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology Continuity Clinic, The UT Physicians Women's Center, and the UT Physicians Women's Center- Bellaire for IUD insertion.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with current pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)
- Women who are not good candidates for an IUD
- Patients who have a Lidocaine allergy

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Paracervical Block
group.description: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine. Lidocaine: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine. Intrauterine device (IUD): IUD placement with or without paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.

group.title: No Analgesia
group.description: IUD placement with no analgesia. No analgesia: IUD placement without analgesia. Intrauterine device (IUD): IUD placement with or without paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.

reported_events.time_frame: From time of speculum placement until the patient left the office (patient leaves office about 3-5 minutes after the procedure, for a total of about 15 minutes from speculum placement to leaving the office).

group.title: Paracervical Block
group.description: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine. Lidocaine: Intrauterine device (IUD) placement with paracervical block with 1% lidocaine. Intrauterine device (IUD): IUD placement with or without paracervical block with 1% lidocaine.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: No Sham Block. Subjects had more variability in baseline pain scores (taken after speculum placement but prior to any procedure) than anticipated, and thus the study was underpowered.

point_of_contact.organization: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
